item.title: #185 - Paco Nathan - AI Myths and Reality
item.description: The amount of hype and bullsh*t in AI is today is sky high. But there's also some awesome achievements happening in the field as well. How do you separate what's real and what's hype? Paco Nathan has been at the forefront of ML and AI, among other fields, for several decades. He joins us to chat about the myths and reality of AI.
item.dc:creator: Ternary Data

We'll also likely dive into behavioral analytics and more.

Solomon Kahn joins us to chat about customer-facing data products and much more. He's one of the people we consider to be at the bleeding edge of modern analytics and data products, so definitely check this out. item.title: #146 - Improving Your Health and Wellness - Techie Edition w/ Colleen Fotsch
item.description: This is a bit of a different episode, but it's a topic that is long overdue for discussion. Between long hours sitting in front of a monitor, "hustle culture", and prevalent alcohol and drug use, our profession is literally killing us. The negative effects on health and wellness among techies are insane. We've seen our friends go to the ER from stress, diet, and lifestyle-related emergencies. We've lost other friends along the way. Colleen Fotsch is uniquely qualified to discuss this issue. She is used to operating at the highest levels of sports, being an NCAA D1-champion swimmer, multiple-time CrossFit Games athlete and coach, and former US Bobsled team member. She also works as a data analyst and part-time coach for Opex, a leader in fitness education coaching (she's Joe's coach). It's time we wake up and look at how we can improve our health and wellness, and bring our best selves to our work and life. Colleen's IG: https://www.instagram.com/colleenfotsch/?hl=en

item.title: #138 - The Rise and Importance of Business Language w/ John O'Gorman
item.description:
Multiple products, versions, platforms, targets technologies, formats, and locales? How do you make sense of the "multiple of multiples" challenge from a technical perspective? The "language of the business" and data in all its structured, semi-structured, and 'unstructured' forms helps drive this home.
John O'Gormanhas world-class expertise in language, semantics, and tying this together for the business. We hope you learn something new from this episode.

item.title: #128 - Big & Small Data in 2023 w/ Joe Reis & Matt Housley
item.description:
There's a lot of debate on big and small data. For systems and compute, some say "Big Data is Dead", while others challenge this notion. In AI and ML, big tech companies can pour tons of money and data into building massive LLMs, while open source provides compelling "small data" alternatives to the LLM walled gardens.
So which is it? Will Big Data reign supreme or will small data become more popular? Matt and I riff on these topics and more.
#data#dataengineering#chatgpt#ai#bigdata

item.title: Thoughtful Data Modeling and Architecture w/ Veronika Durgin - Friday Episode
item.description:
All too often, data models and architecture are an afterthought, often cobbled together with very little rhyme or reason.   

Veronika Durgin (Head of Data @ Saks) joins the show to chat about thoughtful data modeling and architecture. We'll discuss why it pays to be intentional about your data model and architecture. And since this is live streamed on a Friday, we'll probably chat about many other things as well.  

#dataengineering #datamodeling #dataarchitecture

-------------------------

item.title: Winning with IT in a Very Uncertain Environment w/ Niel Nickolaisen - Special Episode
item.description:
Niel Nickolaisen is a CIO's CIO. He's led many successful digital transformations and has the battle scars to prove it.  Niel's here to chat about the IT talent shortage in the rise of low/no-code tools, operating in an environment of low uncertainty, trusting the data, and much more.

item.title: #75 - What's next after the Modern Data Stack?
item.description:
The Modern Data Stack brought a lot of improvements to data workflows and practices. It's also 10 years old (AWS Redshift publicly launched in 2012, kicking off the MDS). Meanwhile, new advancements in streaming-first systems and architectures, ML, etc means we can start to see where things are going next.   What's next after the Modern Data Stack? We're not precisely sure, but we've got an idea.  

Streamed live on YouTube and LinkedIn

item.title: #29 - Cloud Data Warehouse Anti-Patterns
item.description:
Cloud data warehouses such as Snowflake, BigQuery, and Redshift are hugely popular. And rightfully so - they work great for modern data needs. However, people often make costly mistakes when trying to use them.   

This week, we discuss some very common anti-patterns - and solutions for better usage - with cloud data warehouses. We cover general CDW concerns, and best practices for loading and querying data. Enjoy!

---------------------------------

We cover some ideas for what to include in your project portfolio, as well as some suggestions for making it visible to potential hiring managers and recruiters.

---------------------------------

TERNARY DATA

We are Matt and Joe, and were "recovering data scientists". Together, we run a data architecture company called Ternary Data. Ternary Data is not your typical data consultancy. Get no-nonsense, no BS data engineering strategy, coaching, and advice. Trusted by great companies, both huge and small.

Ternary Data Site - https://ternarydata.com

LinkedIn - https://www.linkedin.com/company/ternary-data/

YouTube - https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC3H60XHMp6BrUzR5eUZDyZg

item.title: #25 Is The Cloud A Fad? + Listener Q&A (LinkedIn Live)
item.description:
This week we discuss a VERY popular question we're often asked - "How do I create a data engineering project portfolio?".

We cover some ideas for what to include in your project portfolio, as well as some suggestions for making it visible to potential hiring managers and recruiters.

This is a live Q&A on LinkedIn Live. 

Note: Apologies in advance for Joe's mic, which cut out during the first part of the episode.

-------------------------------------  

TERNARY DATA

We are Matt and Joe, and were "recovering data scientists". Together, we run a data architecture company called Ternary Data. Ternary Data is not your typical data consultancy. Get no-nonsense, no BS data engineering strategy, coaching, and advice. Trusted by great companies, both huge and small.
